reason.tex: \text{Had }f(x) = g(x)\cdot h(x),\text{ then taking logs would}\\ \text{have helped (for the following reason)} \\ \begin{align} f(x) &= g(x)\cdot h(x) \\ \implies \log f(x) &= \log g(x) + \log h(x) \\ \implies \dfrac{1}{f(x)}\cdot f'(x) &= \dfrac{1}{g(x)}\cdot g'(x) + \dfrac{1}{h(x)}\cdot h'(x) \end{align} \\ \underline{\text{But } f(x)\neq g(x)\cdot h(x)}.\\ \text{Instead, }f(x) = g(x) + h(x).\\ \text{Hence, only } f'(x) = g'(x) + h'(x)\text{ is true.}

options.tex: \begin{align} h'(x) &= x^{\log x}\cdot \frac {2}{x}\log x = 2\cdot \log x\cdot x^{(\log x -1)}\\ f'(x) &= g'(x) + h'(x) \\ &= (\log x)^{x-1}[ \,1+(\log x)\cdot \log (\log x)]\\ &+ 2x^{\log x -1}\cdot \log x \end{align} \\

\implies h'(x)&=x^{\log x}\cdot \frac {2}{x}\log x = 2x^{(\log x -1)}\cdot \log x\\ \therefore f'(x) &= \overbrace{(\log x)^{x-1}[ \,1+(\log x)\cdot \log (\log x)]}^{g'(x)}\\ & + \underbrace{2x^{\log x -1}\cdot \log x}_{h'(x)} \end{align}\\
